findings.issue: Uses double negative with totalHourChange (negative value divided by -1B)
GDP impact calculation ignores productivity differences and assumes linear wage-output relationship
Test bounds (-8, -1) don't align with likely model outputs given elasticity ranges

findings.quote: Income effects are based on empirical studies of lottery winners
findings.issue: Claims lottery winner studies used but no evidence these informed the elasticity parameters

findings.quote: The model doesn't capture potential productivity gains
findings.issue: Contradicts earlier GDP calculation which implicitly assumes constant productivity
